DOC.brief_summary: A controlled clinical study comparing the effect of topical aqueous suppressants on intraocular gas duration.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Glaucoma Drops on of the Duration of a Pure Intraocular Gas Bubble
DOC.detailed_description: A Prospective, Randomized Study Comparing the Effects of Topical Aqueous Suppressants on Intraocular Gas Duration following Scleral Buckling and Pneumatic Retinopexy
DOC.criteria: Ability to provide written informed consent and comply with study assessments for the full duration of the study. Have undergone eye surgery including scleral buckling or pneumatic retinopexy for treatment of retinal detachment other condition at the discretion of the investigator. Prior surgery to treat glaucoma. Current use of glaucoma eye drops. Absence of a lens in the eye or presence of a lens implant in front of the iris (colored part of your eye). Allergy or contraindication to any of the glaucoma drops being used in this study (e.g., sulfa allergy, asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (bronchitis or emphysema), slow heart rate).
